text: Linda Lê (1963 – 9 May 2022) was a Vietnamese-born French writer. She won the Fénéon Prize, the Prix Wepler, the Prix Renaudot du livre de poche, and the Prince Pierre de Monaco literary prize. Lê was born in Da Lat, Vietnam. She moved to France in 1977. She published her debut novel when she was 23. Lê died on 9 May 2022, at the age of 58. ==References== Category:1963 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Vietnamese writers Category:French novelists
title: Linda Lê
